intro: Cistanthe sitiens, commonly known as the desert cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland deserts. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in xeriscaped gardens.
